This notebook explains the fundamentals of **data set simulations**, a powerful tool to create a reliable ground truth.

```{r}
n <- 1000

df <- data.frame(
  remote = rep(0:1, n/2),
  skill = runif(n, -1, 1)
) %>% rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(
    lambda = max(15+skill*10, 0),
    loc = rpois(1, lambda),
    happy = rbinom(1, 1, min(0.5+0.3*remote, 1))
  )
```

```{r}
ggplot(df, aes(x=skill)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins = 50)
```


```{r}
ggplot(df, aes(x = loc)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 100)
```


```{r}
df %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = loc, y = as.factor(remote))) +
    geom_boxplot()
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = df, mapping = aes(x = skill, y = loc)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method="lm")
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = df, mapping = aes(x = skill, y = as.factor(happy))) + 
  geom_boxplot()
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = df, mapping = aes(x = as.factor(remote), fill = as.factor(happy))) +
  geom_histogram(stat="count")
```
